title: U.N. Experts Plan Perilous Visit to Ukrainian Nuclear Plant Thursday
description: The international team prepared to cross the front lines to inspect the embattled, Russian-held Zaporizhzhia plant, but it was not clear how long the Russians would let them stay.

title: U.K. Prime Minister Race Ends With Little Focus on Economy
description: The contest to succeed Boris Johnson as Conservative Party leader and prime minister has often seemed divorced from Britain’s fast-growing problems.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: How Authoritarians See Mikhail Gorbachev
description: Plus the decline in American life expectancy and the latest on Typhoon Hinnamnor.

title: The West’s Illusions About Gorbachev and the Victory of Liberalism
description: As the Soviet Union’s final leader, Mikhail Gorbachev dreamed of a “common European home,” but three decades later that tantalizing idea remains out of reach.

title: Families of Israelis Killed at Munich Olympics Reach Compensation Deal
description: The Israeli and German governments announced an agreement after the families said they would boycott a memorial observing the 1972 attack over what they called insufficient recompense.

title: US Life Expectancy Falls Again in ‘Historic’ Setback
description: The decline during the pandemic is the sharpest in nearly 100 years, hitting Native American and Alaska Native communities particularly hard.

title: The experts’ convoy of armored S.U.V.s traveled toward an active battlefield.
E.U. Moves to Restrict Russian Visas, But Does Not Ban Them
description: The suspension of a 2007 agreement with Russia will make visas cost more, require more paperwork and involve longer delays.

title: With War in Ukraine, Putin Tries to Unravel Gorbachev’s Legacy
description: President Vladimir V. Putin calls the end of the Soviet Union a “genuine tragedy” for Russia, and he blamed Mikhail S. Gorbachev for bending to the demands of a treacherous and duplicitous West.

title: Mahathir Mohamad of Malaysia Is Hospitalized With Covid
description: A towering figure in his country’s politics, Mahathir Mohamad was admitted to the hospital for monitoring, and says he’s contemplating another election run at age 97.

title: Our Latest Covid Poll
description: Americans on the left end of the political spectrum have become less anxious about Covid.

title: Gorbachev’s Op-Eds in The Times
description: Mikhail S. Gorbachev wrote often about issues including world affairs and climate change. He also mourned former President Ronald Reagan and the former British prime minister, Margaret Thatcher.

title: How Gorbachev’s Legacy of Perestroika Vanished
description: His vision of a “common European home” stretching from Vladivostok to Lisbon has been replaced by a Russia increasingly isolated from the rest of Europe.

title: Read Your Way Through Mexico City
description: Juan Villoro, who spent over two decades perfecting one book about Mexico City, recommends reading on the city he loves. “Mexico is too complex,” a visitor said. “It needs to be read.”

title: How Reagan and Bush Overcame Skepticism to Collaborate With Gorbachev
description: Mr. Gorbachev was charming and presented himself as a reformer, but neither Ronald Reagan nor George Bush was convinced he was for real. They would both be proved wrong.

title: Putin Sees the War as Part of His Battle to Undo Gorbachev’s Legacy
description: For Mr. Putin, the end of the Soviet Union was the “greatest geopolitical catastrophe of the century,” caused by the weak nerves of a leader too willing to appease the treacherous West.

title: Experts in Ukraine to Inspect Nuclear Plant in Battle Zone
description: A senior adviser to Ukraine’s president said that key aspects of the negotiations between the international team, Ukraine and Russia were in question, including a safe route to the plant itself.
